intro: Auerodendron truncatum, commonly known as the African sandthorn, is a small shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and small, clustered leaves. The plant produces yellowish-green flowers that are followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing on rocky soils. Due to its hardy nature, it is sometimes used in traditional medicine and as a source of forage for livestock.
